entry.title: Newsletter #124
entry.content:

entry.title: Newsletter #109
entry.content:
Yo folks!

This week we bid farewell to one of our team member Nitesh, he posted an interesting summary of his delightful journey at Namshi, we wish him best of luck.

Below you can find the usual list of interesting articles we discovered in the past 7 days.

  • is it realistic to go from 0 coding experience to freelance developer in 6 months of full time study? – quora

  • what frustrates beginner programmers the most? – quora

  • coding interview preparation made easy

  • computer science courses that don’t exist, but should

  • docker container for react native android development

  • dockerfiles considered harmful

  • f8 2015 – big code: developer infrastructure at facebook’s scale – youtube

  • full-stack redux tutorial

  • getify/you-dont-know-js

  • getting started with bem (with a little help from sass)

  • hacker way: facebook’s high performance server infrastructure – youtube

  • hoist is how you integrate – meet the microservices platform that talks to apis

  • how docker helped me love writing css again — meedan updates — medium

  • how we designed the new salesforce at scale

  • hubot newrelic

  • is it possible for a computer to run code that could absolutely destroy the components inside (cooking the cpu, etc.)?

  • is it possible for a computer to run code that could absolutely destroy the components inside (cooking the cpu, etc.)?

  • one weird trick to write better code

  • pulling git into a docker image without leaving ssh keys behind

  • putting react in your react native webview so you can react while you react

  • react.js and dynamic children – why the keys are important – arkency blog

  • real-time resizing of flickr images using gpus

  • redux for reactr

  • restful apis, the big lie

  • stop using tail -f (mostly)

  • the motivation for a monolithic codebase

entry.title: Newsletter #76
entry.content:
Hello folks! It’s #TechThursday at #namshi

We’re super excited to have Nitesh in the Front end team. You can read more about him here

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the weekend:
